greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Iterate the map in A006369 starting at 144.
comment: Lagarias, page 270, appears to imply that this trajectory has period 12 and smallest element 144, which is not true.
reference: J. C. Lagarias, ed., The Ultimate Challenge: The 3x+1 Problem, Amer. Math. Soc., 2010; see page 270.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
mathematica: f[n_] := If[Mod[n, 3] == 0, 2*n/3, Round[4*n/3]]; a[1] = 144; a[n_] := a[n] = f[a[n - 1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 59}]  (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 10 2013 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 04 2011
